subject: Education
title: Priming: Memory Without Awareness
description: A 60-second lesson on Priming: Memory Without Awareness.

hook.text: You read the word 'doctor' and suddenly recognize 'nurse' faster. Your brain was primed.

buildup.text: Priming is a type of implicit memory where exposure to one stimulus influences the next response.

discovery.text: It happens without conscious awarenessâ€”you don't know your brain was pre-loaded with a cue.

twist.text: Amnesia patients who can't form new explicit memories still show priming effects perfectly.

climax.text: Advertisers, designers, and politicians use priming to shape decisions you think are your own.

punchline.text: Not all memory is conscious. Some memories move you silently.

quiz.question: What is priming in the context of memory?
options: Unconscious exposure to a stimulus that influences subsequent responses
A technique for memorizing prime numbers quickly
The first deliberate step in creating any long-term memory
